item.title: National Intersection and Interchange Safety Construction Program Act of 2017
National Intersection and Interchange Safety Construction Program Act of 2017
To direct the Secretary of Transportation to establish a national intersection and interchange safety construction program, and for other purposes.
National Intersection and Interchange Safety Construction Program Act of 2017

bill.title: National Intersection and Interchange Safety Construction Program Act of 2017
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. EMMER:H.R. 2529.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 7--The Congress shall have Power . . . To establish PostOffices and Post RoadsBy Miss GONZALEZ-COLON of Puerto Rico:H.R. 2530.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I section I of the U.S. Constitution``All legislative powers herein granted shall be vested ina Congress of the United States, which shall consist of aSenate and House of Representatives.''By Miss GONZALEZ-COLON of Puerto Rico:H.R. 2531.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section I of the U.S. Constitution``All legislative powers herein granted shall be vested ina Congress of the United States, which shall consist of aSenate and House of Representatives.''[Page H4359]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
